isis.stitle: DT/DTI-466 A and B Series DT/DTI/DTA-466 C Diesel Engine Diagnostics (1993) - ENGINE DIAGNOSTIC TEST PROCEDURES - DT/DTI - 466 A AND B SERIES DIESEL ENGINES - AIR CLEANER MAXIMUM RESTRICTION DT/DTI-466 A and B Series (With UTDS Model 100 Fuel Injection Pump) - SINGLE ELEMENT AIR CLEANER

svcproc.title: SINGLE ELEMENT AIR CLEANER
svcproc.para: Measure air cleaner restriction as follows:

step1.para:
Attach the restriction test (vacuum) gauge (Figure 5.15)
at air cleaner outlet.
Run the engine at high idle RPM.

Replace the air cleaner element when the vacuum gauge (Figure 5.15)
shows 12.5 in H2O (3.13 kPa), when measured at the air cleaner outlet (Figure 5.15)
.

note.para: 1: The true maximum air cleaner restriction can only be obtained when operating the engine at full load and rated speed. The vehicle mounted indicator or vacuum gauge will sense maximum restriction. When 25 in. H2O (6.25 kPa) is sensed on the vehicle mounted gauges, replace the air cleaner element. For convenience, air cleaner restriction can be measured at high idle no load, however, the element must be replaced when 12.5 in. H2O (3.13 kPa) is measured.
2: High air cleaner restriction can cause turbocharger seals to unseat, causing oil to be drawn through seals and into engine.

figure.caption: Figure 5.15 Single Element Air Cleaner Restriction Test
